summary: This is an internal email chain from November 12, 2020, discussing media attention and coordination between FBI and DOJ offices regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation and the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It references a planned DOJ press statement, a meeting with victims in Miami, and a court deadline potentially leading to the release of witness identities in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Mand
persons.context: Addressed in the salutation of the email, appears to be an internal recipient along with others.

events.title: NY Post Article on FBI Briefing
events.description: The NY Post publishes an article stating the FBI is hosting a briefing regarding the current Jeffrey Epstein investigation and sharing findings with victims.

events.title: DOJ Draft Press Statement
events.description: The DOJ has a draft press statement prepared for potential release later in the day regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: FBI Meeting with Victims in Miami
events.description: The FBI is holding a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein in Miami, news of which has gotten out to the media.

events.title: Miami Herald Story on Maxwell Case
events.description: A Miami Herald story from the previous day suggests new information potentially revealing witness identities in the Ghislaine Maxwell case is set for release because a court deadline for witness objections passed.

keyFacts: Internal FBI/DOJ email discusses media coordination around the Epstein investigation and Maxwell case on November 12, 2020.
A DOJ draft press statement regarding the Epstein probe exists and is set for potential release that day.
The FBI is holding a meeting with Epstein victims in Miami, and this information has leaked to the news.
A passed court deadline may lead to the release of witness identities in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, as reported by the Miami Herald.
The email shows internal awareness and concern about media reports from the NY Post and Miami Herald regarding the investigations.
